subject: Re: [junit] how to skip a test at runtime
msgSnippet: ... And of course, TestNG, which lets you specify which groups you want to include in your tests at runtime, making it trivial to only run unit ,
messageBody:
On 1/5/07, Scott Glaser <sglaser@...> wrote:
>
> If your QA team wants to have some automated functional tests I don't
> think
> JUnit would the right tool. They would be better off using a tool for
> acceptance or GUI testing. For web testing tools I would suggest Selenium
> or
> Canoo WebTest. If you need to hook it into JUnit then maybe httpunit or
> jwebunit would work but you will be burdened with maintenance if your QA
> team can't develop in Java.


And of course, TestNG, which lets you specify which groups you want to
include in your tests at runtime, making it trivial to only run "unit" ,
"functional" or "database" tests without having to recompile anything.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
